description: Fake news is actually really easy to spot -- if you know how. Consider this your New Media Literacy Guide.
title: How to outsmart fake news in your Facebook feed

description: It's the prize giving ceremony that everyone's on time for.
title: Revealed: Winners of the 'Oscars of watches'

description: It is a car kitted out with technology its developers boldly predict will transform our cities and change the way we live.
title: Driverless 'Roborace' car makes street track debut

description: Piloting one of the breed of light aircraft is said to be as easy as driving a car
title: Flying a sports car with wings

description: See photos of November's supermoon -- the brightest in nearly 70 years.
title: Brightest supermoon since 1948

description: From infinity and beyond, he found a way to vote.
title: This NASA astronaut voted from space

description: Teenage girls have designed Africa's first private satellite due to launch into space in 2017. It's hoped it can monitor and find answers to South Africa's drought crisis.
title: Teen girls prepare for space launch

description: A six-month stay on the International Space Station can be a pain in the back for astronauts. While they may gain up to 2 inches in height temporarily, that effect is accompanied by a weakening of the muscles supporting the spine, according to a new study.
title: Going to space is a real pain in the back

description: "Attention! Attention!" blares the Russian voice from a loudspeaker. "The nuclear bombs will be launched in one hour."
title: Russian gamers race to prevent nuclear 'war'

description: Thinking about treating your family to a little virtual reality this holiday? Have no idea where to start? Don't worry. From Google's inexpensive Cardboard VR viewer to Sony's new PlayStation VR, this guide will help you figure out what makes sense for your family's interests, needs and budget.
title: What parents should know about the VR gear kids want

description: What do Discman, Tamagotchi, and Game Boy have in common?
title: Japan's boom in weird wearable tech

description: These days, teachers often face classrooms filled with yawning students who stayed up late snapping selfies or playing online games.
title: Cell phones, screens are keeping your kid awake
